body:
Instead of manual string formatting/templating in src/gen/gen_help_html.lua, we simply use `vim.json` to add [json frontmatter](https://gohugo.io/content-management/front-matter/#overview) to each help page.

Hugo happily fills in the layout template from this. The main content of the help page is still generated from `src/gen/gen_help_html.lua` and put below the frontmatter, as actual content. 

Here's the corresponding PR on Nvim core: https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/37972.

This PR mainly targets the css and html skeleton from gen_help_html.lua. The actual html of the actual content of the help page is still generated by gen_help_html.lua. This could probably be done too in Hugo, at which point gen_help_html.lua can just spit out a json representation of the Tree-sitter tree. This would also simplify generating PDFs from the docs (https://github.com/neovim/doc/issues/14, https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/37742)

comment_data.body: @justinmk the [getdocs.lua](https://github.com/neovim/neovim.github.io/pull/437/changes#diff-2a9493c22b13a2b8c484403cfecdd0800ad7e5754387a0be1ec4e8fad18a5106) script requires nvim as script runner, for src/gen/gen_help_html.lua and for runtime/doc. Is this the most straightforward way to get the nvim repo in the GH action?

@@ -0,0 +1,73 @@
+#!/usr/bin/env -S nvim -l
+
+local joinpath = vim.fs.joinpath
+
+local function errprint(msg)
+  vim.api.nvim_echo({ { msg } }, false, { err = true })
+  vim.cmd('q!')
+end
+
+local function usage()
+  local script = vim.fs.basename(_G.arg[0])
+  errprint(vim.text.indent(0, [[
+    Usage: ./%s <source_dir> [<nvim_repo>]
+
+    Arguments:
+      source_dir     Path to the Neovim repository with runtime/doc files
+      nvim_repo      Path to the Neovim repository with src/gen/gen_help_html.lua script
+
+    Example:
+      ./%s ~/Documents/neovim
+    ]]):format(script, script))
+end
+
+---@param cmd string[]
+---@param opts vim.SystemOpts?
+---@return string
+local function sys(cmd, opts)
+  local ok, res = pcall(function()
+    return vim.system(cmd, opts or {}):wait()
+  end)
+  if not ok or res.code ~= 0 or res.signal ~= 0 then
+    local err = type(res) == 'string' and res or res.stderr
+    errprint(('Error while running %s:\n\t%s'):format(table.concat(cmd, ' '), err))
+  end
+  return res.stdout
+end
+
+local function commit_hash(dir)
+  local hash = sys({ 'git', 'rev-parse', 'HEAD' }, { cwd = dir }):gsub('%s', '')
+  return (hash and #hash > 0) and hash or '?'
+end
+
+local function main()
+  if #_G.arg < 1 then
+    usage()
+  end
+
+  local srcdir = _G.arg[1]
+  local nvim_repo = _G.arg[2] or _G.arg[1]
+
+  local docdir = joinpath(srcdir, 'runtime/doc')
+  local usercontent = 'content/doc/user'
+
+  -- Generate html pages from the Vimdoc files
+  local genhelp = dofile(joinpath(nvim_repo, 'src/gen/gen_help_html.lua'))
+  genhelp.gen(docdir, usercontent, nil, commit_hash(srcdir))
+
+  local out_install = 'content/doc/install.md'
+  sys({ 'hugo', 'new', 'content', '--force', out_install })
+  vim.fn.writefile(vim.fn.readfile(joinpath(srcdir, 'INSTALL.md')), out_install, 'a')
+  vim.cmd.edit(out_install)
+  vim.cmd([[%s!BUILD\.md!build/!g]])

@@ -0,0 +1,73 @@
+#!/usr/bin/env -S nvim -l
+
+local joinpath = vim.fs.joinpath
+
+local function errprint(msg)
+  vim.api.nvim_echo({ { msg } }, false, { err = true })
+  vim.cmd('q!')
+end
+
+local function usage()
+  local script = vim.fs.basename(_G.arg[0])
+  errprint(vim.text.indent(0, [[
+    Usage: ./%s <source_dir> [<nvim_repo>]
+
+    Arguments:
+      source_dir     Path to the Neovim repository with runtime/doc files
+      nvim_repo      Path to the Neovim repository with src/gen/gen_help_html.lua script
+
+    Example:
+      ./%s ~/Documents/neovim
+    ]]):format(script, script))
+end
+
+---@param cmd string[]
+---@param opts vim.SystemOpts?
+---@return string
+local function sys(cmd, opts)
+  local ok, res = pcall(function()
+    return vim.system(cmd, opts or {}):wait()
+  end)
+  if not ok or res.code ~= 0 or res.signal ~= 0 then
+    local err = type(res) == 'string' and res or res.stderr
+    errprint(('Error while running %s:\n\t%s'):format(table.concat(cmd, ' '), err))
+  end
+  return res.stdout
+end
+
+local function commit_hash(dir)
+  local hash = sys({ 'git', 'rev-parse', 'HEAD' }, { cwd = dir }):gsub('%s', '')
+  return (hash and #hash > 0) and hash or '?'
+end
+
+local function main()
+  if #_G.arg < 1 then
+    usage()
+  end
+
+  local srcdir = _G.arg[1]
+  local nvim_repo = _G.arg[2] or _G.arg[1]
+
+  local docdir = joinpath(srcdir, 'runtime/doc')
+  local usercontent = 'content/doc/user'
+
+  -- Generate html pages from the Vimdoc files
+  local genhelp = dofile(joinpath(nvim_repo, 'src/gen/gen_help_html.lua'))
+  genhelp.gen(docdir, usercontent, nil, commit_hash(srcdir))
+
+  local out_install = 'content/doc/install.md'
+  sys({ 'hugo', 'new', 'content', '--force', out_install })
+  vim.fn.writefile(vim.fn.readfile(joinpath(srcdir, 'INSTALL.md')), out_install, 'a')
+  vim.cmd.edit(out_install)
+  vim.cmd([[%s!BUILD\.md!build/!g]])
+  vim.cmd([[w]])
+
+  local out_build = 'content/doc/build.md'
+  sys({ 'hugo', 'new', 'content', '--force', out_build })
+  vim.fn.writefile(vim.fn.readfile(joinpath(srcdir, 'BUILD.md')), out_build, 'a')
+  vim.cmd.edit(out_build)
+  vim.cmd([[%s!INSTALL\.md!install/!g]])

comment_data.body: Dropped the vimpatch report. I like the idea of eliminating neovim/doc , though there are some other reports we might want such as https://github.com/neovim/doc/issues/69 (but... it likely makes sense to do that either here, or in the neovim core repo)

comment_regular_data.body:
Tangential: Is it possible with this to mark the documentation (e.g., in a header) clearly as "prerelease/master/0.12-dev"? That's been a long-standing footgun.

(Ideally, we'd have versioned docs, but that's tricky if we want to continue tweaking the basic infrastructure.)

Yes. I can imagine something like:

```
$ (cd nvim-doc-src && git checkout v0.11)
$ ./build.sh nvim-doc-src/runtime/doc content/doc/v0.11/user
$ (cd nvim-doc-src && git checkout master)
$ ./build.sh nvim-doc-src/runtime/doc content/doc/user
```

Here, `build.sh` stands in for a script that generates the documentation using `gen_help_html.lua` and Hugo and `nvim-doc-src` is a Git clone of neovim/neovim used solely for the runtime/doc folder of a specific version.

Seems to me that this could work for generating docs for all Git-tagged versions.

The reason I started working on this is to simplify the process of bringing the help docs in the core repo to the website. Currently that's spread over three repo's with different actions and shell scripts.

I'll keep the versioned-docs problem in mind while working on this, should definitely be doable.
Versioned docs are definitely a stretch goal; having a prominent hard-coded "prerelease" in the header until then would already go a long way.

### Status update

1. ~Hugo doesn't allow setting the permalink format per sub-section, only per section. This means that `/doc/{install,build}/` also need to be `/doc/{install,build}.html` in order for the user doc pages to have `.html` (which is done for backwards compat I think).~ Use Hugo aliases to redirect .html pages to their newer form.
1. `gendoc.lua` script generates `content/doc/user/*.html` and `content/doc/{install,build}.md` sources. It requires a local Nvim repo to run (for gen_help_html.lua). This step is not required for local development.
2. GH action checks out neovim/neovim and runs the gendoc.lua script. This currently fails because it depends on https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/37972.
3. To test locally:
  ```bash
  gh pr checkout 437
  ./gendoc.lua path/to/your/nvim/repo
  hugo serve
  ```

### Necessary steps to continue
1. Merge https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/37972 to generate pages with Hugo frontmatter
2. Merge this PR. After this, the build should work, but the neovim/doc repo probably "overwrites" the `/doc` path of the website.
3. Disable th gh-pages deployment of neovim/doc. The new `/doc/user` pages should then be live.

### Remaining questions
- Is the vim-patch report workflow from neovim/doc still necessary to be included on the website? The page seems a bit abandoned.

> 1\. ... This means that `/doc/{install,build}/` also need to be `/doc/{install,build}.html` in order for the user doc pages to have `.html` (which is done for backwards compat I think).

If possible, we want to drop the `.html` suffix from the docs pages. Should we try to do this as part of this, or will that complicate things?

Technically it will require a "migration" but we could do that as a followup. It's ok if the old `.html` links are broken for a few days.

I think I've looked into Hugo pages having multiple output paths (i.e. support both `/doc/user/api` and `/doc/user/api.html`) a while ago but I couldn't get it to work. 

~We could, as a migration, have a small `for f in public/doc/user/*/index.html; do cp $f $(dirname $f).html; done` in the GH action. Or I can see if I can get a client-side redirect working for the .html pages (probably also manually scripted -- again, Hugo doesn't like this).~ 

~If you're fine with urls pointing to the old .html docs breaking then it's a two-line change to just remove `[uglyUrls] doc = true` from the config.~

EDIT: I forgot about [aliases](https://gohugo.io/methods/page/aliases/). I'll add that to the frontmatter. Should be fixed then.

Hugo now creates `/doc/user/api.html` that initiates a client-side redirect to `/doc/user/api/`.

Fantastic! We can yolo merge this after CI passes, I feel confident that you will followup on any problems.

So to review, can you confirm:

- no more `.html` ðŸš€  (+ redirects from old URLs)
- this eliminates the https://github.com/neovim/doc/blob/main/ci/doc-index.sh hack which copied `doc2/` from here?
- this eliminates https://github.com/neovim/doc/blob/main/ci/user-docu.sh (per item 3: `Disable the gh-pages deployment of neovim/doc`)

> Is the vim-patch report workflow from neovim/doc still necessary to be included on the website? The page seems a bit abandoned.

Nope, we can delete it https://github.com/neovim/doc/pull/68 . It's no longer needed since [version.c is now fully the source of truth](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/36585).

> no more .html ðŸš€ (+ redirects from old URLs)

âœ… All html pages are userdocs and redirect to their "prettyUrl" counterpart: `/doc/user/api.html` --> `/doc/user/api/`.

> this eliminates the [neovim/doc@main/ci/doc-index.sh](https://github.com/neovim/doc/blob/main/ci/doc-index.sh?rgh-link-date=2026-02-23T21%3A48%3A29Z) hack which copied doc2/ from here?

No need for doc2 anymore: everything can be kept in `content/doc`, `content/doc/{install,build}.md` and `content/doc/user/*` are generated by docgen.lua. They don't have to be commited to this repo (just generated on the fly by GH actions (= single source of truth :))).

> this eliminates [neovim/doc@main/ci/user-docu.sh](https://github.com/neovim/doc/blob/main/ci/user-docu.sh?rgh-link-date=2026-02-23T21%3A48%3A29Z) (per item 3: Disable the gh-pages deployment of neovim/doc)

Yes. This fully takes care of the `/doc/user` pages. I'm fairly certain the whole neovim/doc repo can be archieved after merge. With this PR, it is also trivial to extend this with versioned docs, e.g. `./gendocs.lua ~/nvim-repo-v0.11 content/user/v0.11`.

> I feel confident that you will followup on any problems.

Sure! You can always ping me may issues arise.


Again, one important note: this won't work without https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/37972. That PR needs to be merged first in order to get the doc pages in the right format.
Merged https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/37972 , but CI is failing in this pr
Thanks, I'll take a look at it

The build seems to succeed now. The Hugo overview also shows the same numbers on my machine as on my machine:

ummm website doesn't seem broken so not an emergency. but we should fix:

- may need to run `:helptags ALL` or something like that

title: Generate doc/user/ pages with Hugo
